messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] Books on eBay
messages.msgSnippet: I couldn t agree with you more Andres. Congradulations to eBay s marketing team! There is this perception out there that if it s on eBay, it must be cheap!
messages.messageBody:
I couldn't agree with you more Andres. Congradulations to eBay's marketing
team! There is this perception out there that if it's on eBay, it must be
cheap!� Amazon in general has THE best prices out there!
�
Mark
�

[Mark Jaillet]��-----Original Message-----
From: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com [mailto:nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com]On
Behalf Of Andres Pedraza
Sent: Monday, February 13, 2006 3:14 PM
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com; nihonto@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nihontostudy] Books on eBay



Does anybody understand why people buy books on eBay for prices way
above what Amazon, for example, is charging? I see this all too
often. Do people not check other online sources before bidding?

Amazon ($29.70 w/free shipping): HYPERLINK
"http://tinyurl.com/8hkax"http://tinyurl.com/8hkax

eBay (bidding starts at $41.99 + shipping): HYPERLINK
"http://tinyurl.com/dqaeo"http://tinyurl.com/dqaeo

Or am I missing something here? I can understand when we're talking
about out-of-print/hard-to-find volumes, but books currently
available? And the book is a good reference, too. It's in my library
already. It just seems to me that we already spend enough money on
our hobby as it is, without wasting our hard earned cash needlessly.

And that was my gripe of the day. Thanks for listening.

Dewa,

Andres

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
